title: Games won't start, received queue buster.. Please Help
body: Hey, i play Legaue of Legends on a Mac, and since today, my legaue games won't start.. Champ select works fine as per usual, however once the league of legends "game" tab opens to display the loading screen, my macbook is frozen on a black screen. During this, i'm unable to move my mouse or Command tab, to look at my other applications... Its literally just stuck. I've tried waiting over 30 minutes for this black screen to dissapear but it never did. the only way to get rid of it was to manually power off my macbook and restart it. I've tried playing on multiple accounts, to see if my account was bugged however it didnt work on either. Also, before you refer me to Riot's useless "connection guide", I've already tried and there is nothing usefull on there that can help me for my situation.. I also feel like my queue buster was unnecessary  as I didn't intentionally AFK, and i was really looking forward to playing. Please Help

replies.body:
Hey Terry ! o/

Check that your Macintosh meets these minimum requirements:
_- Mac OS X version 10.8.5 or higher.
- 4 Go of minimum RAM.
- 8 Go at least free space on the hard drive once the game is installed._

Check the application's permissions are correct:

- _Applications_ > Right click on _League of Legends_> _Get Information_.
- Click on the padlock and enter the administrator password.
- Display the "Share and Permissions" tab.
- Make sure that all users have the "Writing and Reading" mode in the Privileges column.

Open the client and go to the upper right corner, to the gear > _Start Complete Repair_.

Hope this helps you. :P
